{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Specific incidents where YouTube has been blocked include:\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Private individuals"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and large production corporations"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " have used YouTube to grow their audiences. Indie creators have built grassroots followings numbering in the thousands at very little cost or effort, while mass retail and radio promotion proved problematic."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Concurrently, "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " celebrities moved into the website at the invitation of a YouTube management that witnessed early content creators accruing substantial followings and perceived audience sizes potentially larger than that attainable by television."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " While YouTube's revenue-sharing \"Partner Program\" made it possible to earn a substantial living as a video producer\u2014its top five hundred partners each earning more than $100,000 annually"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and its ten highest-earning channels grossing from $2.5\u00a0million to $12\u00a0million"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\u2014in 2012 "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " business editor characterized YouTube as \"a free-to-use ... promotional platform for the music labels.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2013 "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Katheryn Thayer asserted that digital-era artists' work must not only be of high quality, but must elicit reactions on the YouTube platform and social media."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Videos of the 2.5% of artists categorized as \"mega\", \"mainstream\" and \"mid-sized\" received 90.3% of the relevant views on YouTube and Vevo in that year."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " By early 2013, "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " had announced that it was factoring YouTube streaming data into calculation of the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and related genre charts."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Observing that face-to-face communication of the type that online videos convey has been \"fine-tuned by millions of years of evolution\", "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " curator "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " referred to several YouTube contributors and asserted that \"what "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " did for writing, online video can now do for face-to-face communication.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Anderson asserted that it is not far-fetched to say that online video will dramatically accelerate scientific advance, and that video contributors may be about to launch \"the biggest learning cycle in human history.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In education, for example, the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " grew from YouTube video tutoring sessions for founder Salman Khan's cousin into what "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " called \"the largest school in the world\", with technology poised to "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " how people learn."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " YouTube was awarded a 2008 "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " the website being described as a "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " that \"both embodies and promotes democracy.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " reported that a disproportionate share of YouTube's most-subscribed channels feature minorities, contrasting with mainstream television in which the stars are largely white."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " A "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " study reported the development of \"visual journalism\", in which citizen eyewitnesses and established news organizations share in content creation."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The study also concluded that YouTube was becoming an important platform by which people acquire news."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "YouTube has enabled people to more directly engage with government, such as in the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " (2007) in which ordinary people submitted questions to U.S. presidential candidates via YouTube video, with a "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " co-founder saying that Internet video was changing the political landscape."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Describing the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " (2010\u20132012), sociologist "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " quoted an activist's succinct description that organizing the political unrest involved using \"Facebook to schedule the protests, Twitter to coordinate, and YouTube to tell the world.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2012, more than a third of the U.S. Senate introduced a resolution condemning "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " 16 days after the \""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\" video was posted to YouTube, with resolution co-sponsor Senator "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " remarking that the video \"will do more to lead to (Kony's) demise than all other action combined.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Conversely, YouTube has also allowed government to more easily engage with citizens, the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "'s official YouTube channel being the seventh top news organization producer on YouTube in 2012"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and in 2013 a healthcare exchange commissioned Obama impersonator "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "'s YouTube music video spoof to encourage young Americans to enroll in the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "-compliant health insurance."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In February 2014, U.S. President Obama held a meeting at the White House with leading YouTube content creators not only to promote awareness of Obamacare"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " but more generally to develop ways for government to better connect with the \"YouTube Generation\"."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Whereas YouTube's inherent ability to allow presidents to directly connect with average citizens was noted, the YouTube content creators' "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " savvy was perceived necessary to better cope with the website's distracting content and fickle audience."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Some YouTube videos have themselves had a direct effect on world events, such as "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " (2012) which spurred "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " internationally."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " TED curator Chris Anderson described a phenomenon by which geographically distributed individuals in a certain field share their independently developed skills in YouTube videos, thus challenging others to improve their own skills, and spurring invention and evolution in that field."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Journalist "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " stated in "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " that such videos have \"surprising implications\" for the dissemination of culture and even the future of classical music."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "A 2017 article in "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " posited that YouTube had become \"the new "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\" for the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Almost a year before YouTube's January 2019 announcement that it would begin a \"gradual change\" of \"reducing "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " of borderline content and content that could misinform users in harmful ways\","}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Zeynep Tufekci had written in "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " that, \"(g)iven its billion or so users, YouTube may be one of the most powerful radicalizing instruments of the 21st century\"."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Under YouTube's changes to its recommendation engine, the most-recommended channel evolved from conspiracy theorist "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " (2016) to "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " (2019)."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " According to a 2020 study, viewership of far-right videos on YouTube peaked in 2017 and \"a growing body of journalistic evidence\" suggested that YouTube was radicalizing young men through its recommendation engine, but that such evidence was \"fraught with a bias towards sensationalism\". It also found more \"mainstream-adjacent Conservative creators\" gaining over "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and extremist videos by 2020."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2022 study found that \"despite widespread concerns that YouTube's algorithms send people down 'rabbit holes' with recommendations to extremist videos, little systematic evidence exists to support this conjecture\", and that such exposure was \"heavily concentrated among a small group of people with high prior levels of gender and racial resentment.\""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2024 study by the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " found that YouTube frequently recommended Christian videos and right-leaning and culturally conservative \""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\" videos by Fox News and male lifestyle "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " to accounts that did not show an interest in such topics."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and the "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " selected their membership based on individual video performances."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Further, the cyber-collaboration charity video \""}

{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " with "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " noting the \"We Pray for You\" YouTube cyber-collaboration video as an example of a trend to use crowdsourcing for charitable purposes."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\nThe anti-bullying "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " expanded from a single YouTube video directed to discouraged or "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ","}

{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", Vice President Biden, White House staff, and several cabinet secretaries."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " Similarly, in response to fifteen-year-old "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "'s video \"My story: Struggling, bullying, suicide, self-harm\", legislative action was undertaken almost immediately after her suicide to study the prevalence of bullying and form a national anti-bullying strategy."}

{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", YouTube deleted 30 videos."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Prior to 2020, Google did not provide detailed figures for YouTube's running costs, and YouTube's revenues in 2007 were noted as \""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\" in a regulatory filing."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In June 2008, a "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " magazine article projected the 2008 revenue at $200\u00a0million, noting progress in advertising sales."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2012, YouTube's revenue from its ads program was estimated at $3.7\u00a0billion."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2013, it nearly doubled and estimated to hit $5.6\u00a0billion according to "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " while others estimated $4.7\u00a0billion."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The vast majority of videos on YouTube are free to view and supported by advertising."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In May 2013, YouTube introduced a trial scheme of 53 subscription channels with prices ranging from $0.99 to $6.99 a month."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The move was seen as an attempt to compete with other providers of online subscription services such as "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", and Hulu."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "Google first published exact revenue numbers for YouTube in February 2020 as part of Alphabet's 2019 financial report. According to Google, YouTube had made "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " in ad revenue in 2019, in contrast to "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " in 2017 and "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " in 2018. YouTube's revenues made up nearly 10% of the total Alphabet revenue in 2019."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " These revenues accounted for approximately 20\u00a0million subscribers combined between YouTube Premium and YouTube Music subscriptions, and 2\u00a0million subscribers to YouTube TV."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "YouTube had $29.2\u00a0billion ads revenue in 2022, up by $398\u00a0million from the prior year."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In Q2 2024, ad revenue rose to $8.66"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "billion, up 13% on Q1."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "YouTube entered into a marketing and advertising partnership with "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " in June 2006."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In March 2007, it struck a deal with "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " for three channels with BBC content, one for news and two for entertainment."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2008, YouTube reached an agreement with "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", allowing the companies to post full-length films and television episodes on the site, accompanied by advertisements in a section for U.S. viewers called \"Shows\". The move was intended to create competition with websites such as Hulu, which features material from NBC, "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2009, YouTube launched a version of \"Shows\" available to UK viewers, offering around 4,000 full-length shows from more than 60 partners."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In January 2010, YouTube introduced an online film rentals service,"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " which is only available to users in the United States, Canada, and the UK as of 2010."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The service offers over 6,000 films."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "In March 2017, the government of the United Kingdom pulled its advertising campaigns from YouTube, after reports that its ads had appeared on videos containing extremist content. The government demanded assurances that its advertising would \"be delivered safely and appropriately\". "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " newspaper, as well as other major British and U.S. brands, similarly suspended their advertising on YouTube in response to their advertising appearing near "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ". Google stated that it had \"begun an extensive review of our advertising policies and have made a public commitment to put in place changes that give brands more control over where their ads appear\"."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In early April 2017, the YouTube channel "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " presented evidence claiming that a "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " article had fabricated screenshots showing major brand advertising on an offensive video containing "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " music overlaid on a "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " music video, citing that the video itself had not earned any ad revenue for the uploader. The video was retracted after it was found that the ads had been triggered by the use of copyrighted content in the video."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "On April 6, 2017, YouTube announced that to \"ensure revenue only flows to creators who are playing by the rules\", it would change its practices to require that a channel undergo a policy compliance review, and have at least 10,000-lifetime views, before they may join the Partner Program."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "In May 2007, YouTube launched its Partner Program (YPP), a system based on "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " which allows the uploader of the video to share the revenue produced by advertising on the site."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " YouTube typically takes 45 percent of the advertising revenue from videos in the Partner Program, with 55 percent going to the uploader."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "There are over two million members of the YouTube Partner Program."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " According to "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", in 2013 a pre-roll advertisement on YouTube (one that is shown before the video starts) cost advertisers on average $7.60 per 1000 views. Usually, no more than half of the eligible videos have a pre-roll advertisement, due to a lack of interested advertisers."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "YouTube's policies restrict certain forms of content from being included in videos being monetized with advertising, including videos containing violence, strong language, sexual content, \"controversial or sensitive subjects and events, including subjects related to war, political conflicts, natural disasters and tragedies, even if graphic imagery is not shown\" (unless the content is \"usually newsworthy or comedic and the creator's intent is to inform or entertain\"),"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and videos whose user comments contain \"inappropriate\" content."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2013, YouTube introduced an option for channels with at least a thousand subscribers to require a paid subscription for viewers to watch videos."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In April 2017, YouTube set an eligibility requirement of 10,000 lifetime views for a paid subscription."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " On January 16, 2018, the eligibility requirement for monetization was changed to 4,000 hours of watch-time within the past 12 months and 1,000 subscribers."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The move was seen as an attempt to ensure that videos being monetized did not lead to controversy, but was criticized for penalizing smaller YouTube channels."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ", a part of the YouTube Creator Rewards, are a recognition by YouTube of its most popular channels."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " The trophies made of nickel plated copper-nickel alloy, golden plated brass, silver plated metal, ruby, and red tinted crystal glass are given to channels with at least one hundred thousand, a million, ten million, fifty million subscribers, and one hundred million subscribers, respectively."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "YouTube's policies on \""}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\" restrict what may be incorporated into videos being monetized; this includes strong violence, language,"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " sexual content, and \"controversial or sensitive subjects and events, including subjects related to war, political conflicts, natural disasters and tragedies, even if graphic imagery is not shown\", unless the content is \"usually newsworthy or comedic and the creator's intent is to inform or entertain\"."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In September 2016, after introducing an enhanced notification system to inform users of these violations, YouTube's policies were criticized by prominent users, including "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " and "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": ". DeFranco argued that not being able to earn advertising revenue on such videos was \"censorship by a different name\". A YouTube spokesperson stated that while the policy itself was not new, the service had \"improved the notification and appeal process to ensure better communication to our creators\"."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " reported in 2019 that LGBT keywords resulted in demonetization."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "In the United States as of November 2020, and June 2021 worldwide,"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " YouTube reserves the right to monetize any video on the platform, even if their uploader is not a member of the YouTube Partner Program. This will occur on channels whose content is deemed \"advertiser-friendly\", and all revenue will go directly to Google without any share given to the uploader."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": "The majority of YouTube's advertising revenue goes to the publishers and video producers who hold the rights to their videos; the company retains 45% of the ad revenue."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2010, it was reported that nearly a third of the videos with advertisements were uploaded without permission of the copyright holders. YouTube gives an option for copyright holders to locate and remove their videos or to have them continue running for revenue."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In May 2013, "}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " began enforcing its copyright ownership and claiming the advertising revenue from video creators who posted screenshots of its games."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " In February 2015, Nintendo agreed to share the revenue with the video creators through the Nintendo Creators Program."}
{"title": ["YouTube"], "image": [], "desc": " On March 20, 2019, Nintendo announced on Twitter that the company will end the Creators program. Operations for the program ceased on March 20, 2019."}

The trends deemed the most popular on the platform often highlight a specific day of the week to post the material on. Examples of popular trends include #SelfieSunday, in which users post a photo of their faces on Sundays; #MotivationMonday, in which users post motivational photos on Mondays; #TransformationTuesday, in which users post photos highlighting differences from the past to the present; #WomanCrushWednesday, in which users post photos of women they have a romantic interest in or view favorably, as well as its #ManCrushMonday counterpart centered on men; and #ThrowbackThursday, in which users post a photo from their past, highlighting a particular moment."}

Users who follow each other can send private messages with photos and videos, in contrast to the public-only requirement that was previously in place. When users receive a private message from someone they don't follow, the message is marked as pending and the user must accept to see it. Users can send a photo to a maximum of 15 people."}

Girls with an Instagram account only differed from girls without an account in terms of skipping meals; they also had a stricter exercise schedule, a pattern not found in boys. This suggests a possible negative effect of Instagram usage on body satisfaction and disordered eating for both boys and girls."}

The study also reported preliminary evidence of the online posts affecting offline behavior, but stopped short of claiming causality. At the same time, some benefits for those who engage with self-harm content online have been suggested."}

Instagram is one of the most popular social media channels for sharenting. The hashtag #letthembelittle contains over 10 million images related to children on Instagram. Bare 2020 analysed 300 randomly selected, publicly available images under the hashtag and found that the corresponding images tended to contain children's personal information, including name, age and location."}

{"title": ["Instagram"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Instagram_logo_2022.svg/130px-Instagram_logo_2022.svg.png", "//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Instagram_logo.svg/150px-Instagram_logo.svg.png"], "desc": ", Instagram's users are divided equally, with 50% iPhone owners and 50% Android owners. While Instagram has a neutral gender-bias format, 68% of Instagram users are female and 32% are male. Instagram's geographical use is shown to favor urban areas, as 17% of US adults who live in urban areas use Instagram, while only 11% of adults in suburban and rural areas do so. While Instagram may appear to be one of the most widely used sites for photo sharing, only 7% of daily photo uploads, among the top four photo-sharing platforms, come from Instagram. Instagram has been proven to attract the younger generation, with 90% of its 150\u00a0million users under the age of 35. From June 2012 to June 2013, Instagram approximately doubled their number of users. With regards to income, 15% of US Internet users who make less than $30,000 per year use Instagram, while 14% of those making $30,000 to $50,000 and 12% of users who make more than $50,000 per year do so."}
{"title": ["Instagram"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/95/Instagram_logo_2022.svg/130px-Instagram_logo_2022.svg.png", "//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2a/Instagram_logo.svg/150px-Instagram_logo.svg.png"], "desc": " With respect to the education demographic, respondents with some college education proved to be the most active on Instagram, with 23%. Following behind, college graduates consist of 18% and users with a high school diploma or less make up 15%. Among these Instagram users, 24% say they use the app several times a day."}

The lawsuit claims that Meta and its Instagram unit repeatedly misled the public about the dangers of its platforms and knowingly induced young children and teenagers into addictive and compulsive social media use. Meta representatives replied that they were disappointed with the lawsuit and were hoping instead to continue working with other companies from the industry to create new and better standards for applications teens use."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". It is one of the world's largest "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " platforms and one of the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users can share short text messages, images, and videos in "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " commonly known as \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" (officially \"posts\") and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " other users' content."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The platform also includes "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", video and audio calling, bookmarks, lists, communities, a chatbot ("}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "), job search,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and Spaces, a social audio feature. Users can vote on context added by approved users using the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " feature.\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter was created in March 2006 by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and was launched in July of that year. Twitter grew quickly; by 2012 more than 100 million users produced 340 million daily tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter, Inc., was based in San Francisco, California, and had more than 25 offices around the world."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A signature characteristic of the service initially was that posts were required to be brief. Posts were initially limited to 140 characters, which was changed to 280 characters in 2017. The limitation was removed for subscribed accounts in 2023."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " 10% of users produce over 80% of tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2020, it was estimated that approximately 48 million accounts (15% of all accounts) were run by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " rather than humans."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The service is owned by the American company "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", which was established to succeed the prior owner "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in March 2023 following the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " for US$44 billion. Musk stated that his goal with the acquisition was to promote "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " on the platform. "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the platform has been criticized for enabling the increased spread of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " succeeded Musk as CEO on June 5, 2023, with Musk remaining as the chairman and the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In July 2023, Musk announced that Twitter would be rebranded to \"X\" and the bird logo would be retired,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " a process which was completed by May 2024. Since Musk's takeover, data from app-tracking firms has shown that global usage of Twitter has declined by approximately 15%, compared to a decline of 5\u201310% in some other social media sites."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The platform has disputed that usage has dropped at all, with Musk saying that membership had grown to 600 million users as of a May 2024"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " tweet."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " By October 2024, the platform was estimated to have lost about 72\u00a0percent of its value since Musk acquired it."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " This trend reversed in the following months as many advertisers returned to the platform"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and as of February 2025, it regained its original valuation."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " claims to have introduced the idea of an individual using an SMS service to communicate to a small group in 2006."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The original "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " for the service was "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", an idea that Williams later ascribed to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " inspired by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and the five-character length of American SMS "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". The decision was also partly due to the fact that the domain twitter.com was already in use, and it was six months after the launch of twttr that the crew purchased the domain and changed the name of the service to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Work on the project started in February 2006."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The first Twitter prototype, developed by Dorsey and contractor Florian Weber, was used as an internal service for "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " employees."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The full version was introduced publicly on July 15, 2006."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In October 2006, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Dorsey, and other members of Odeo formed Obvious Corporation and acquired Odeo from the investors and shareholders."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Williams fired Glass, who was silent about his part in Twitter's startup until 2011."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter spun off into its own company in April 2007."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " for Twitter's popularity was the 2007 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (SXSWi) conference. During the event, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " increased from 20,000 tweets per day to 60,000."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\nThe company experienced rapid initial growth thereafter. In 2009, Twitter won the \"Breakout of the Year\" "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In February 2010, Twitter users were sending "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " tweets per day."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " By March 2010, the company recorded over 70,000 registered applications."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In June 2010, about "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " tweets were posted each day, equaling about 750 tweets sent each second, according to Twitter."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " As noted on "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Twitter moved up to the third-highest-ranking "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " site in January 2009 from its previous rank of twenty-second."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "From September through October 2010, the company began rolling out \"New Twitter\", an entirely revamped edition of twitter.com. Changes included the ability to see pictures and videos without leaving Twitter itself by clicking on individual tweets which contain links to images and clips from a variety of supported websites, including YouTube and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and a complete overhaul of the interface."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2019, Twitter was announced to be the 10th most downloaded mobile app of the decade, from 2010 to 2019."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On March 21, 2012, Twitter celebrated its sixth birthday by announcing that it had 140 million users, a 40% rise from September 2011, who were sending 340 million tweets per day."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On June 5, 2012, a modified logo was unveiled through the company blog, removing the text to showcase the slightly redesigned bird as the sole symbol of Twitter."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On December 18, 2012, Twitter announced it had surpassed 200 million "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "  In September 2013, the company's data showed that 200 million users sent over 400 million tweets daily, with nearly 60% of tweets sent from mobile devices."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In April 2014, Twitter underwent a redesign that made the site resemble Facebook somewhat, with a profile picture and biography in a column left to the timeline, and a full-width header image with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " effect."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Late in 2015, it became apparent that growth had slowed, according to Fortune,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Business Insider,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Marketing Land"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and other news websites including Quartz (in 2016)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2019, Twitter released another redesign of its user interface."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " By the start of 2019"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Twitter had more than 330 million monthly active users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter then experienced considerable growth during the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in 2020."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The platform also was increasingly used for "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter started marking tweets which contained misleading information, and adding links to fact-checks."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In 2021, Twitter began the research phase of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", an "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " decentralized social media protocol where users can choose which "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " they want."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The same year, Twitter also released Twitter Spaces, a social audio feature;"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " \"super follows\", a way to subscribe to creators for exclusive content;"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and a beta of \"ticketed Spaces\", which makes access to certain audio rooms paid."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter unveiled a redesign in August 2021, with adjusted colors and a new Chirp font, which improves the left-alignment of most Western languages.\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Tweets were publicly visible by default, but senders can restrict message delivery to only their followers. Users can mute users they do not wish to interact with, block accounts from viewing their posts, and remove accounts from their followers list."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users can post via the Twitter website, compatible external applications (such as for "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "), or by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (SMS) available in certain countries."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users may subscribe to other users' posts\u2014this is known as \"following\" and subscribers are known as \"followers\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " or \"tweeps\", a portmanteau of Twitter and peeps."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Individual posts can be forwarded by other users to their own feed, a process known as a \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" (officially \"repost\"). In 2015, Twitter launched \"quote tweet\" (originally called \"retweet with comment\" and officially just \"quote\"),"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " a feature which allows users to add a comment to their post, imbedding one post in the other."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users can also \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" (formerly \"favorite\") individual tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The counters for likes, retweets, and replies appear next to the respective buttons in timelines such as on profile pages and search results. Counters for likes and reposts exist on a post's standalone page too. Since September 2020, quote tweets, formerly known as \"retweet with comment\", have their own counter on their post page."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Until the legacy desktop front end that was discontinued in 2020, a row with miniature profile pictures of up to ten liking or retweeting users was displayed (earliest documented implementation in December 2011 overhaul), as well as a tweet reply counter next to the according button on a tweet's page."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter allows users to update their profile via their mobile phones either by text messaging or by apps released for certain smartphones and tablets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter announced in a tweet on September 1, 2022, that the ability to edit a tweet was being tested for select users. Eventually, all "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " subscribers would be able to use the feature."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users can group posts together by topic or type by use of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " \u2013 words or phrases prefixed with a \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" sign. Similarly, the \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" sign followed by a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " is used for mentioning or replying to other users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2014, Twitter introduced hashflags, special hashtags that automatically generate a custom "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " next to them for a certain period of time."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Hashflags may be generated by Twitter themselves"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " or be purchased by corporations."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " To repost a message from another user and share it with one's own followers, a user can click the repost button within the post. Users can reply to other accounts' replies. Users can hide replies to their messages and select who can reply to each of their tweets before sending them: anyone, accounts who follow the post's author, specific accounts, or none."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The original, strict 140 character limit was gradually relaxed. In 2016, Twitter announced that attachments, links, and media such as photos, videos, and the person's handle, would no longer count; a user photo post used to count for around 24 characters."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2017, Twitter handles were similarly excluded."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The same year, Twitter doubled its historical 140-character-limitation to 280."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Under the new limit, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " are counted as a variable number of characters, depending upon the script they are from."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2023, Twitter announced that Twitter Blue users could create posts with up to 4,000 characters in length."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter intended the service to protect users from malicious sites,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and to use it to track clicks on links within tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter had previously used the services of third parties "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In June 2011, Twitter announced its own integrated photo-sharing service that enables users to upload a photo and attach it to a Tweet right from Twitter.com."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Users now also have the ability to add pictures to Twitter's search by adding hashtags to the tweet."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter also plans to provide photo galleries designed to gather and syndicate all photos that a user has uploaded on Twitter and third-party services such as "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " accessible via screen reading software or by hovering the mouse above a picture inside "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". In April 2022, Twitter made the ability to add and view captions globally available. Descriptions can be added to any uploaded image with a limit of 1000 characters. Images that have a description will feature a badge that says "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in the bottom left corner, which will bring up the description when clicked."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In Twitter's early years, users could communicate with Twitter using SMS. Twitter discontinued this feature in most countries in April 2023, after hackers had exposed vulnerabilities in the feature."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In March 2020, Twitter began to test a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " feature known as \"fleets\" in some markets,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " which officially launched on November 17, 2020."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Fleets could contain text and media, are only accessible for 24 hours after they are posted, and are accessed within the Twitter app;"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter announced it would start implementing advertising into fleets in June 2021."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Fleets were removed in August 2021; Twitter had intended for fleets to encourage more users to tweet regularly, but instead they were generally used by already-active users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter introduced its \"trends\" feature in mid-2008, an algorithmic lists of trending topics among users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A word or phrase mentioned can become \"trending topic\" based on an algorithm."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Because a relatively small number of users can affect trending topics through a concerted campaign, the feature has been the targeted of concerted manipulation campaigns."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " While some campaigns are innocuous, others have promoted conspiracy theories or hoaxes, or sought to amplify extremist messages."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Some featured trends are globally displayed, while others are limited to a specific country."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "A 2021 study by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " researchers found that frequent \"ephemeral "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" efforts targeted at Trends; from 2015 to 2019, \"47% of local trends in Turkey and 20% of global trends are fake, created from scratch by bots...The fake trends discovered include "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " apps, gambling promotions, disinformation campaigns, political slogans, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " against vulnerable populations and even marriage proposals.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " reported that, as of 2022, Twitter \"sometimes manually overrides particularly objectionable trends\" and, for some trends, used both algorithmic and human input to select representative tweets with context."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In late 2009, the \"Twitter Lists\" feature was added, making it possible for users to follow a curated list of accounts all at once, rather than following individual users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Currently,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " lists can be set to either public or private. Public lists may be recommended to users via the general Lists interface and appear in search results."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " If a user follows a public list, it will appear in the \"View Lists\" section of their profile, so that other users may quickly find it and follow it as well."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Private lists can only be followed if the creator shares a specific link to their list. Lists add a separate tab to the Twitter interface with the title of the list, such as \"News\" or \"Economics\".\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In October 2015, Twitter introduced \"Moments\"\u2014a feature that allows users to curate tweets from other users into a larger collection. Twitter initially intended the feature to be used by its in-house editorial team and other partners; they populated a dedicated tab in Twitter's apps, chronicling news headlines, sporting events, and other content."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In September 2016, creation of moments became available to all Twitter users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On October 21, 2021, a report based on a \"long-running, massive-scale randomized experiment\" that analyzed \"millions of tweets sent between 1 April and 15 August 2020\", found that Twitter's "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " amplified right-leaning politics on personalized user Home timelines."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The report compared seven countries with active Twitter users where data was available (Germany, Canada, the United Kingdom, Japan, France, and Spain) and examined tweets \"from major political groups and politicians\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Researchers used the 2019 Chapel Hill Expert Survey (CHESDATA) to position parties on political ideology within each country."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The \"machine learning algorithms\", introduced by Twitter in 2016, personalized 99% of users' feeds by displaying tweets (even older tweets and retweets from accounts the user had not directly followed) that the algorithm had \"deemed relevant\" to the users' past preferences."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter randomly chose 1% of users whose Home timelines displayed content in reverse-chronological order from users they directly followed."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In April 2017, Twitter introduced "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " designed for regions with unreliable and slow Internet connections, with a size of less than one "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", designed for devices with limited storage capacity."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On June 3, 2021, Twitter announced a paid subscription service called Twitter Blue. Following "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the subscription service was initially renamed to X Blue (or simply Blue), and, on August 5, 2023, was rebranded as "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (or simply Premium)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The subscription provides additional premium features to the service."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2023 a \"Premium+\" subscription was launched, with a higher monthly fee giving benefits such as the omission of adverts on For You and Following feeds."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In November 2022, Musk announced plans to add account verification and the ability to upload longer audio and video to Twitter Blue. A previous perk offering advertising-free news articles from participating publishers was dropped, but Musk stated that Twitter did want to work with publishers on a similar \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " bypass\" perk."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Musk had pushed for a more expensive version of Twitter Blue following his takeover, arguing that it would be needed to offset a decline in advertising revenue."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter states that paid verification is required to help reduce fraudulent accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The verification marker was included in a premium tier of Twitter Blue introduced on November 9, 2022, priced at US$7.99 per month."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On November 11, 2022, after the introduction of this feature led to prominent issues involving accounts using the feature to impersonate public figures and companies, Twitter Blue with verification was temporarily suspended."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " After about a month, Twitter Blue was relaunched on December 12, 2022, though for those purchasing the service through the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the cost will be $10.99 a month as to offset the 30% revenue split that Apple takes."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter initially grandfathered users and entities that had gained verification due to their status as public figures, referring to them as \"legacy verified accounts\" that \"may or may not be notable\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On March 25, 2023, it was announced that \"legacy\" verification status would be removed; a subscription will be required to retain verified status, costing $1,000 per-month for organizations (which are designated with a gold verified symbol),"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " plus an additional $50 for each \"affiliate\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The change was originally scheduled for April 1, 2023, but was delayed to April 20, 2023, following criticism of the changes."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Musk also announced plans for the \"For You\" timeline to prioritize verified accounts and user followers only beginning April 15, 2023, and threatened to only allow verified users to participate in polls (although the latter change has yet to occur)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Effective April 21, 2023, Twitter requires companies to participate in the verified organizations program to purchase advertising on the platform, although companies that spend at least $1,000 on advertising per-month automatically receive membership in the program at no additional cost."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "From April 25, 2023, verified users are now prioritized in replies to tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In June 2021, the company opened applications for its premium subscription options called Super Follows. This lets eligible accounts charge $2.99, $4.99 or $9.99 per month to subscribe to the account."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The launch only generated about $6,000 in its first two weeks."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2023, the Super Follows feature was rebranded as simply \"subscriptions\", allowing users to publish exclusive long-form posts and videos for their subscribers; the pivot in marketing was reportedly intended to help compete with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In May 2021, Twitter began testing a Tip Jar feature on its iOS and Android clients. The feature allows users to send monetary tips to certain accounts, providing a financial incentive for content creators on the platform. The Tip Jar is optional and users can choose whether or not to enable tips for their account."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On September 23, 2021, Twitter announced that it will allow users to tip users on the social network with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". The feature will be available for iOS users. Previously, users could tip with fiat currency using services such as Square's "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and PayPal's "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". Twitter will integrate the Strike bitcoin lightning wallet service. It was noted that at this current time, Twitter will not take a cut of any money sent through the tips feature."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On August 27, 2021, Twitter rolled out Ticketed Spaces, which let Twitter Spaces hosts charge between $1 and $999 for access to their rooms."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In April 2022, Twitter announced that it will partner with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " for piloting cryptocurrency payouts for limited users in the platform. Eligible users of Ticketed Spaces and Super Follows will be able to receive their earnings in the form of USD coin, a stablecoin whose value is that of the U.S. dollar. Users can also hold their earnings in crypto wallets, and then exchange them into other cryptocurrencies."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In July 2021, Twitter began testing a \"Shop module\" for iOS users in the United States, allowing accounts associated with brands to display a carousel of cards on their profiles showcasing products. Unlike the Buy button, where order fulfillment was handed from within Twitter, these cards are external links to online storefronts from which the products may be purchased."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In March 2022, Twitter expanded the test to allow companies to showcase up to 50 products on their profiles."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2021, Twitter introduced support for \"shoppable\" live streams, in which brands can hold streaming events that similarly display banners and pages highlighting products that are featured in the presentation."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Daily user estimates vary as the company does not publish statistics on active accounts. A February 2009 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " blog entry ranked Twitter as the third most used social network based on their count of 6 million unique monthly visitors and 55 million monthly visits."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " An April 2017 a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " blog entry ranked Twitter as the tenth most used social network based on their count of 319 million monthly visitors."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Its global user base in 2017 was 328 million."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " According to Musk, the platform had 500 million monthly active users in March 2023, 550 million in March 2024, and 600 million in May 2024."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In 2009, Twitter was mainly used by older adults who might not have used other social sites before Twitter."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " According to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " only 11% of Twitter's users were aged 12 to 17."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " According to a study by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in June 2009, women made up a slightly larger Twitter demographic than men\u201453% over 47%. It also stated that 5% of users accounted for 75% of all activity."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " According to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", 27 million people in the US used Twitter in September 2009; 63% of Twitter users were under 35 years old; 60% of Twitter users were Caucasian, but a higher than average (compared to other Internet properties) were African American/black (16%) and Hispanic (11%); 58% of Twitter users have a total household income of at least US$60,000."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The prevalence of African American Twitter usage and in many popular hashtags has been the subject of research studies."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter grew from 100 million monthly active users (MAUs) in September 2011,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " to 255 million in March 2014,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and more than 330 million in early 2019."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2013, there were over 100 million users actively using Twitter daily and about 500 million tweets every day."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2016 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " found that Twitter is used by 24% of all online US adults. It was equally popular with men and women (24% and 25% of online Americans respectively), but more popular with younger generations (36% of 18\u201329-year olds)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2019 survey conducted by the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " found that Twitter users are three times as likely to be younger than 50 years old, with the median age of adult U.S. users being 40. The survey found that 10% of users who are most active on Twitter are responsible for 80% of all tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "-based market-research firm Pear Analytics analyzed 2,000 tweets (originating from the United States and in English) over a two-week period in August 2009 from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm (CST) and separated them into six categories."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " made up 40%, with 38% being conversational. Pass-along value had 9%, self-promotion 6% with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and news each making 4%.\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Despite Jack Dorsey's own open contention that a message on Twitter is \"a short burst of inconsequential information\", social networking researcher "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " responded to the Pear Analytics survey by arguing that what the Pear researchers labeled \"pointless babble\" is better characterized as \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" or \"peripheral awareness\" (which she justifies as persons \"want[ing] to know what the people around them are thinking and doing and feeling, even when co-presence isn't viable\")."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Similarly, a survey of Twitter users found that a more specific social role of passing along messages that include a hyperlink is an expectation of reciprocal linking by followers."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "According to research published in April 2014, around 44% of user accounts have never tweeted."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " About 22% of Americans say they have used Twitter, according to a 2019 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " survey."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2009, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " reported that Twitter had a user-retention rate of 40%. Many people stop using the service after a month; therefore the site may potentially reach only about 10% of all "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Noting how demographics of Twitter users differ from the average Americans, commentators have cautioned against media narratives that treat Twitter as representative of the population,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " adding that only 10% of users Tweet actively, and that 90% of Twitter users have Tweeted no more than twice. In 2016, shareholders sued Twitter, alleging it \"artificially inflated its stock price by misleading them about user engagement\". The company announced on September 20, 2021, that it would pay $809.5 million to settle this class-action lawsuit."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "User engagement is usually measured by the number of likes, replies and reposts. A 2023 study showed that retweets are more likely to contain positive content and address larger audiences using the first-person "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " \"we\". Replies, on the other hand, are more likely to contain negative content and address individuals using the second-person pronoun \"you\" and the third-person pronouns \"he\" or \"she\". While influencers with many followers tend to post positive messages, often using the word \"love\" when addressing larger audiences, users with less followers tend to engage in "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " conversations to provoke user engagement."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Before its rebranding to X, Twitter was internationally identifiable by its signature bird logo, or the Twitter Bird. The original logo, which was simply the word "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", was in use from its launch in March 2006. It was accompanied by an image of a bird which was later discovered to be a piece of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " created by the British graphic designer "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A new logo had to be redesigned by founder Biz Stone with help from designer Philip Pascuzzo, which resulted in a more cartoon-like bird in 2009. This version had been named \"Larry the Bird\" after "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " of the NBA's "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " fame."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Within a year, the Larry the Bird logo underwent a redesign by Stone and Pascuzzo to eliminate the cartoon features, leaving a solid silhouette of Larry the Bird that was used from 2010 through 2012."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2012, Douglas Bowman created a further simplified version of Larry the Bird, keeping the solid silhouette but making it more similar to a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " This logo was simply called the \"Twitter Bird\" and was used until July 2023."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " advertising model."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In June 2011, Twitter announced that it would offer small businesses a self-service advertising system."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In April 2013, Twitter announced that its Twitter Ads self-service platform, consisting of promoted tweets and promoted accounts, was available to all U.S. users without an invite."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On August 3, 2016, Twitter launched Instant Unlock Card, a new feature that encourages people to tweet about a brand to earn rewards and use the social media network's conversational ads. The format itself consists of images or videos with call-to-action buttons and a customizable hashtag."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In October 2019, Twitter announced it would stop running political ads on its ad platform effective November 22. This resulted from several spurious claims made by political ads. Company CEO Dorsey clarified that internet advertising had great power and was extremely effective for commercial advertisers, the power brings significant risks to politics where crucial decisions impact millions of lives."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The company reversed the ban in August 2023,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " publishing criteria governing political advertising which do not allow the promotion of false or misleading content, and requiring advertisers to comply with laws, with compliance being the sole responsibility of the advertiser."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In April 2022, Twitter announced a ban on \"misleading\" advertisements that go against \"the scientific consensus on climate change\". {"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter relies on "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The Twitter Web interface uses the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " framework,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " deployed on a performance enhanced "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " implementation of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In the early days of Twitter, tweets were stored in "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " databases that were temporally "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (large databases were split based on time of posting). After the huge volume of tweets coming in caused problems reading from and writing to these databases, the company decided that the system needed re-engineering."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "From Spring 2007 to 2008, the messages were handled by a Ruby "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " queue server called Starling."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Since 2009, implementation has been gradually replaced with software written in "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The switch from Ruby to Scala and the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " has given Twitter a performance boost from 200 to 300 requests per second per host to around 10,000\u201320,000 requests per second per host. This boost was greater than the 10x improvement that Twitter's engineers envisioned when starting the switch. The continued development of Twitter has also involved a switch from monolithic development of a single app to an architecture where different services are built independently and joined through "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "As of April 6, 2011, Twitter engineers confirmed that they had switched away from their Ruby on Rails search stack to a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " server they call Blender."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Individual tweets are registered under unique IDs called "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and geolocation data is added using 'Rockdove'. The URL shortener "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " then checks for a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " link and shortens the URL. Next, the tweets are stored in a MySQL database using "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and the user receives an acknowledgement that the tweets were sent. Tweets are then sent to search engines via the Firehose API. The process is managed by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and takes an average of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On August 16, 2013, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Twitter's vice president of platform engineering, shared in a blog post that the company's infrastructure handled almost 143,000 tweets per second during that week, setting a new record. Krikorian explained that Twitter achieved this record by blending its homegrown and open source technologies."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "X Money, a payment system, is under development."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter was recognized for having one of the most open and powerful developer "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " of any major technology company."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The service's API allows other "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and applications to integrate with Twitter."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Developer interest in Twitter began immediately following its launch, prompting the company to release the first version of its public API in September 2006."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The API quickly became iconic as a reference implementation for public "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and is widely cited in programming tutorials."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "From 2006 until 2010, Twitter's developer platform experienced strong growth and a highly favorable reputation. Developers built upon the public API to create the first Twitter mobile phone clients as well as the first URL shortener. Between 2010 and 2012, however, Twitter made a number of decisions that were received unfavorably by the developer community."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2010, Twitter mandated that all developers adopt "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " authentication with just 9 weeks of notice."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Later that year, Twitter launched its own URL shortener, in direct competition with some of its most well-known third-party developers."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " And in 2012, Twitter introduced stricter usage limits for its API, \"completely crippling\" some developers."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " While these moves successfully increased the stability and security of the service, they were broadly perceived as hostile to developers, causing them to lose trust in the platform."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In July 2020, Twitter released version 2.0 of the public API"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and began showcasing Twitter apps made by third-party developers on its Twitter Toolbox section in April 2022."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In January 2023, Twitter ended third-party access to its APIs, forcing all third-party Twitter clients to shut down."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " This was controversial among the developer community, as many third-party apps predated the company's official apps, and the change was not announced beforehand. Twitterrific's Sean Heber confirmed in a blog post that the 16-year-old app has been discontinued. \"We are sorry to say that the app's sudden and undignified demise is due to an unannounced and undocumented policy change by an increasingly capricious Twitter \u2013 a Twitter that we no longer recognize as trustworthy nor want to work with any longer.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In February 2023, Twitter announced it would be ending free access to Twitter API, and began offering paid tier plans with a more limited access."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On April 17, 2012, Twitter announced it would implement an \"Innovators Patent Agreement\" which would obligate Twitter to only use its patents "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter has a history of both using and releasing "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " while overcoming technical challenges of their service."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A page in their developer documentation thanks dozens of open-source projects which they have used, from "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " software like "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On March 31, 2023, Twitter released the "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " which determines what tweets show up on the user's personal timeline, to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". According to Twitter's blog post: \"We believe that we have a responsibility, as the town square of the internet, to make our platform transparent.
