{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the CEO at the time, had been promising the move for a while \u2013 on March 24, 2022, before he owned the site, he polled his followers about whether Twitter's algorithm should be open source, and around 83% of the responses said \"yes\". In February, he promised it would happen within a week before pushing back the deadline to March 31 earlier this month."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Also in March 2023, Twitter suffered a security attack which resulted in proprietary code being released. Twitter then had the source code removed."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter introduced the first major redesign of its user interface in September 2010, adopting a dual-pane layout with a navigation bar along the top of the screen, and an increased focus on the inline embedding of multimedia content. Critics considered the redesign an attempt to emulate features and experiences found in mobile apps and third-party Twitter clients."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The new layout was revised in 2011 with a focus on continuity with the web and mobile versions, introducing \"Connect\" (interactions with other users such as replies) and \"Discover\" (further information regarding trending topics and news headlines) tabs, an updated profile design, and moving all content to the right pane (leaving the left pane dedicated to functions and the trending topics list)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In March 2012, Twitter became available in Arabic, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In September 2012, a new layout for profiles was introduced, with larger \"covers\" that could be customized with a custom header image, and a display of the user's recent photos posted."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The \"Discover\" tab was discontinued in April 2015,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and was succeeded on the mobile app by an \"Explore\" tab\u2014which features trending topics and moments."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In September 2018, Twitter began to migrate selected web users to its "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (based on its Twitter Lite experience for mobile web), reducing the interface to two columns. Migrations to this iteration of Twitter increased in April 2019, with some users receiving it with a modified layout."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In July 2019, Twitter officially released this redesign, with no further option to opt-out while logged in. It is designed to further-unify Twitter's user experience between the web and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " versions, adopting a three-column layout with a sidebar containing links to common areas (including \"Explore\" that has been merged with the search page) which previously appeared in a horizontal top bar, profile elements such as picture and header images and biography texts merged into the same column as the timeline, and features from the mobile version (such as multi-account support, and an opt-out for the \"top tweets\" mode on the timeline)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In response to early Twitter security breaches, the United States "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (FTC) brought charges against the service; the charges were settled on June 24, 2010. This was the first time the FTC had taken action against a social network for security lapses. The settlement requires Twitter to take a number of steps to secure users' private information, including maintenance of a \"comprehensive information security program\" to be independently audited biannually."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " After a number of high-profile hacks of official accounts, including those of the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in April 2013, Twitter announced a two-factor login verification as an added measure against hacking."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On July 15, 2020, a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " affected 130 high-profile accounts, both verified and unverified ones such as "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "; the hack allowed "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " scammers to send tweets via the compromised accounts that asked the followers to send bitcoin to a given public address, with the promise to double their money."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Within a few hours, Twitter disabled tweeting and reset passwords from all verified accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Analysis of the event revealed that the scammers had used "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " to obtain credentials from Twitter employees to access an administration tool used by Twitter to view and change these accounts' personal details as to gain access as part of a \""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\" attempt to make money quickly, with an estimated "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in bitcoin deposited in various accounts before Twitter intervened."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Several law enforcement entities including the FBI launched investigations into the attack."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On August 5, 2022, Twitter disclosed that a bug introduced in a June 2021 update to the service allowed threat actors to link email addresses and phone numbers to twitter user's accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The bug was reported through Twitter's "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in January 2022 and subsequently fixed. While Twitter originally believed no one had taken advantage of the vulnerability, it was later revealed that a user on the online hacking forum "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " had used the vulnerability to compile a list of over 5.4 million user profiles, which they offered to sell for $30,000."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The information compiled by the hacker includes user's screen names, location and email addresses which could be used in "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " attacks or used to deanonymize accounts running under pseudonyms.\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "During an outage, Twitter users were at one time shown the \"fail whale\" "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " image created by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ","}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " illustrating eight orange birds using a net to hoist a whale from the ocean captioned \"Too many tweets! Please wait a moment and try again.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Web designer and Twitter user "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " was the first to coin the term \"fail whale\" in a September 2007 tweet."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In a November 2013 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " interview Chris Fry, VP of Engineering at that time, noted that the company had taken the \"fail whale\" out of use as the platform was now more stable."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter had approximately 98% "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in 2007 (or about six full days of downtime)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The downtime was particularly noticeable during events popular with the technology industry such as the 2008 "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " keynote address."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In June 2009, after being criticized by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and sued by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " over unauthorized accounts run by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the company launched their \"Verified Accounts\" program."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter stated that an account with a \"blue tick\" verification badge indicates \"we've been in contact with the person or entity the account is representing and verified that it is approved\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In July 2016, Twitter announced a public application process to grant verified status to an account \"if it is determined to be of public interest\" and that verification \"does not imply an endorsement\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Verified status allows access to some features unavailable to other users, such as only seeing mentions from other verified accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In November 2020, Twitter announced a relaunch of its verification system in 2021. According to the new policy, Twitter verifies six different types of accounts; for three of them (companies, brands, and influential individuals like activists), the existence of a Wikipedia page will be one criterion for showing that the account has \"Off Twitter Notability\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter states that it will re-open public verification applications at some point in \"early 2021\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In October 2022, after the takeover of Twitter by Elon Musk, it was reported that verification would instead be included in the paid Twitter Blue service, and that existing verified accounts would lose their status if they do not subscribe."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On November 1, Musk confirmed that verification would be included in Blue in the future, dismissing the existing verification system as a \"lords & peasants system\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " After concerns over the possibility of impersonation, Twitter subsequently reimplemented a second \"Official\" marker, consisting of a grey tick and \"Official\" text displayed under the username, for high-profile accounts of \"government and commercial entities\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In December 2022, the \"Official\" text was replaced by a gold checkmark for organizations, as well as a grey check mark for government and multilateral accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In March 2023, the gold check mark was made available for organizations to purchase through the Verified Organizations program (formerly called Twitter Blue for Business)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Tweets are public, but users can also send private \"direct messages\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Information about who has chosen to follow an account and who a user has chosen to follow is also public, though accounts can be changed to \"protected\" which limits this information (and all tweets) to approved followers."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter collects "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " about its users and shares it with third parties as specified in its "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". The service also reserves the right to sell this information as an asset if the company changes hands."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Advertisers can "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " based on their history of tweets and may quote tweets in ads"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " directed specifically to the user.\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter launched the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " of their \"Verified Accounts\" service on June 11, 2009, allowing people with public profiles to announce their account name. The profile pages of these accounts display a badge indicating their status."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On December 14, 2010, the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " issued a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " to provide information for accounts registered to or associated with "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter decided to notify its users and said, \"... it's our policy to notify users about law enforcement and governmental requests for their information, unless we are prevented by law from doing so.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "On October 9, 2020, Twitter took additional steps to counter misleading campaigns ahead of the 2020 US Election. Twitter's new temporary update encouraged users to \"add their own commentary\" before retweeting a tweet, by making 'quoting tweet' a mandatory feature instead of optional. The social network giant aimed at generating context and encouraging the circulation of more thoughtful content."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " After limited results, the company ended this experiment in December 2020."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In 2016, Twitter announced the creation of the Twitter Trust & Safety Council to help \"ensure that people feel safe expressing themselves on Twitter\". The council's inaugural members included 50 organizations and individuals."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The announcement of Twitter's \"Trust & Safety Council\" was met with objection from parts of its userbase."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Critics accused the member organizations of being heavily skewed towards \"the restriction of hate speech\" and a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " article expressed concern that \"there's not a single uncompromising anti-censorship figure or group on the list\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter banned 7,000 accounts and limited 150,000 more that had ties to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " on July 21, 2020. The bans and limits came after QAnon-related accounts began harassing other users through practices of swarming or brigading, coordinated attacks on these individuals through multiple accounts in the weeks prior. Those accounts limited by Twitter will not appear in searches nor be promoted in other Twitter functions. Twitter said they will continue to ban or limit accounts as necessary, with their support account stating \"We will permanently suspend accounts Tweeting about these topics that we know are engaged in violations of our multi-account policy, coordinating abuse around individual victims, or are attempting to evade a previous suspension\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In September 2021, Twitter began beta testing a feature called Safety Mode."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The functionality aims to limit unwelcome interactions through automated detection of negative engagements. If a user has Safety Mode enabled, authors of tweets that are identified by Twitter's technology as being harmful or exercising uninvited behavior will be temporarily unable to follow the account, send direct messages, or see tweets from the user with the enabled functionality during the temporary block period."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Jarrod Doherty, senior product manager at Twitter, stated that the technology in place within Safety Mode assesses existing relationships to prevent blocking accounts that the user frequently interacts with."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In January 2016, Twitter was sued by the widow of a U.S. man killed in the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", claiming that allowing the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " (ISIL) to continually use the platform, including direct messages in particular,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " constituted the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", which is illegal under U.S. federal law. Twitter disputed the claim, stating that \"violent threats and the promotion of terrorism deserve no place on Twitter and, like other social networks, our rules make that clear\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The lawsuit was dismissed by the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", upholding the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " safe harbor, which dictates that the operators of an interactive computer service are not liable for the content published by its users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The lawsuit was revised in August 2016, providing comparisons to other telecommunications devices."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The second amended complaint was dismissed by the district court, a decision affirmed on appeal to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit on January 31, 2018."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In August 2016, Twitter stated that it had banned 235,000 accounts over the past six months, bringing the overall number of suspended accounts to 360,000 accounts in the past year, for violating policies banning use of the platform to promote extremism."}

According to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Legal, Policy and Trust and Safety Lead at Twitter, there was a reduction of 19% terror related tweets from the previous reporting period (January\u2013June 2018)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "As of July 30, 2020, Twitter will block URLs in tweets that point to external websites that contain malicious content (such as malware and phishing content) as well as hate speech, speech encouraging violence, terrorism, child sexual exploitation, breaches of privacy, and other similar content that is already banned as part of the content of tweets on the site. Users that frequently point to such sites may have their accounts suspended. Twitter said this was to bring their policy in line to prevent users from bypassing their tweet content restrictions by simply linking to the banned content."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "A bot is a computer program that can automatically tweet, retweet, and follow other accounts. Twitter's open "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and the availability of cloud servers make it possible for bots to exist within the social networking site."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Benign bots may generate creative content and relevant product updates, whereas malicious bots can make unpopular people seem popular, push irrelevant products on users, and spread misinformation, spam or slander."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Bots amass significant influence and have been noted to sway elections, influence the stock market, appeal to the public, and attack governments."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " As of 2013"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Twitter said there were 20 million fake accounts on Twitter, representing less than 5% of active users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2020 estimate put the figure at 15% of all accounts or around 48 million accounts."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In April 2022, Twitter convened a \"Red Team\" for the project of ACM, \"Adult Content Monetization\", as it is known internally. Eventually, the project was abandoned, because of the difficulty of implementing Real ID."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "A February 2021 report from the company's Health team begins, \"While the amount of CSE (child sexual exploitation) online has grown exponentially, Twitter's investment in technologies to detect and manage the growth has not.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Until February 2022, the only way for users to flag illegal content was to flag it as \"sensitive media\", a broad category that left much of the worst material unprioritized for moderation. In a February report, employees wrote that Twitter, along with other Tech Companies have \"accelerated the pace of CSE content creation and distribution to a breaking point where manual detection, review, and investigations no longer scale\" by allowing pornography and failing to invest in systems that could effectively monitor it. The working group made several recommendations, but they were not taken up and the group was disbanded."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " As part of its efforts to monetize porn, Twitter held an internal investigation which reported in April 2022, \"Twitter cannot accurately detect child sexual exploitation and non-consensual nudity at scale.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", a civil lawsuit filed in the 9th Circuit Court, alleges that Twitter benefited from sex trafficking and refused to remove the illegal tweets when first informed of them."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In an amicus brief filed in the case, the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " said, \"The children informed the company that they were minors, that they had been 'baited, harassed, and threatened' into making the videos, that they were victims of 'sex abuse' under investigation by law enforcement\" but Twitter failed to remove the videos, \"allowing them to be viewed by hundreds of thousands of the platform's users\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Some major brands, including "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " suspended their marketing campaigns and pulled their ads from the platform after an investigation showed that Twitter failed to suspend 70% of the accounts that shared or solicited the prohibited content."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "A practical use for Twitter's real-time functionality is as an effective "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " emergency communication system for breaking news. It was neither intended nor designed for high-performance communication, but the idea that it could be used for emergency communication was not lost on the creators, who knew that the service could have wide-reaching effects early on when the company used it to communicate during earthquakes."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\nAnother practical use that is being studied is Twitter's ability to track epidemics and how they spread."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Additionally Twitter serves as a real-time sensor for natural disasters such as bushfires and earthquakes."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter has been adopted as a communication and learning tool in educational and research"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " settings mostly in colleges and universities."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " It has been used as a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " to promote student interactions, especially in large-lecture courses."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Research has found that using Twitter in college courses helps students communicate with each other and faculty, promotes informal learning, allows shy students a forum for increased participation, increases student engagement, and improves overall course grades."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter has been an increasingly growing in the field of education as an effective tool that can be used to encourage learning and idea, or knowledge sharing, in and outside the classroom."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " By using or creating hashtags, students and educators are able to communicate under specific categories of their choice to enhance and promote education. A broad example of a hashtag used in education is \"edchat\", to communicate with other teachers and people using that hashtag. Once teachers find someone they want to talk to, they can either direct message the person or narrow down the hashtag to make the topic of the conversation more specific, using hashtags for scichat (science), engchat (English), sschat (social studies)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", professor of Internet law at "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", said that \"the qualities that make Twitter seem inane and half-baked are what makes it so powerful.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In that same vein, and with Sigmund Freud in mind, political communications expert Matthew Auer observed that well-crafted tweets by public figures often deliberately mix trivial and serious information so as to appeal to all three parts of the reader's personality: the id, ego, and superego."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The poets "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " published a book titled "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " featuring selections of their tweets over some eight years."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The novelist "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " wrote a short story for Electric Literature called \"Some Contemporary Characters\", composed entirely of tweets."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Many commentators have suggested that Twitter radically changed the format of reporting due to instant, short, and frequent communication."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " According to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " writers Benjamin M. Reilly and Robinson Meyer, Twitter has an outsized impact on the public discourse and media. \"Something happens on Twitter; celebrities, politicians and journalists talk about it, and it's circulated to a wider audience by Twitter's algorithms; journalists write about the dustup.\" This can lead to an argument on a Twitter feed looking like a \"debate roiling the country... regular people are left with a confused, agitated view of our current political discourse\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In a 2018 article in the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Matthew Ingram argued much the same about Twitter's \"oversized role\" and that it promotes immediacy over newsworthiness."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In some cases, inauthentic and provocative tweets were taken up as common opinion in mainstream articles. Writers in several outlets unintentionally cited the opinions of Russian "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "-affiliated accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "World leaders and their diplomats have taken note of Twitter's rapid expansion and have been increasingly using "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the use of Twitter to engage with foreign publics and their own citizens. US Ambassador to Russia, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " has been attributed as a pioneer of international Twitter diplomacy. He used Twitter after becoming ambassador in 2011, posting in English and Russian."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On October 24, 2014, "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " sent her first tweet to mark the opening of the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "'s Information Age exhibition."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " A 2013 study by website Twiplomacy found that 153 of the 193 countries represented at the United Nations had established government Twitter accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The same study also found that those accounts amounted to 505 Twitter handles used by world leaders and their foreign ministers, with their tweets able to reach a combined audience of over 106 million followers."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "According to an analysis of accounts, the heads of state of 125 countries and 139 other leading politicians have Twitter accounts that have between them sent more than 350,000 tweets and have almost 52 million followers. However, only 30 of these do their own tweeting, more than 80 do not subscribe to other politicians and many do not follow any accounts."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "The Twitter account for the pope was set up in 2012. As of February\u00a02025"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", it has 18 million followers (@Pontifex)."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter is banned completely in Russia,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Iran, China and North Korea"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and has been intermittently blocked in numerous countries, including Egypt, Iraq, Nigeria, Turkey, Venezuela and Turkmenistan on different basis."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In 2016, Twitter cooperated with the Israeli government to remove certain content originating outside Israel from tweets seen in Israel."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In the 11th biannual transparency report published on September 19, 2017, Twitter said that Turkey was the first among countries where about 90% of removal requests came from, followed by Russia, France and Germany."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter stated that between July 1 and December 31, 2018, \"We received legal demands relating to 27,283 accounts from 47 different countries, including Bulgaria, Kyrgyzstan, Macedonia, and Slovenia for the first time.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " As part of evidence to a U.S. Senate Enquiry, the company admitted that their systems \"detected and hid\" several hundred thousand tweets relating to the "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " after "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " by October 25, nearly one million tweets had been removed as a result."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter removed more than 88,000 propaganda accounts linked to Saudi Arabia."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Twitter removed tweets from accounts associated with the Russian "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " that had tried to influence public opinion during and after the 2016 US election."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " Party, or Turkey's President "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", identified based on centralized behavior."}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "'s government for its conduct during "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "At the start of the 2020 COVID-19 pandemic, numerous tweets reported false medical information related to the pandemic. Twitter announced a new policy in which they would label tweets containing misinformation going forward."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In April 2020, Twitter removed accounts which defended President "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "'s response to the spread of COVID-19 in the Philippines."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2020, then Chief Technology Officer and future CEO of Twitter "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", when asked by "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " about balancing the protection of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " as a core value and the endeavour to combat misinformation, said: \"Our role is not to be bound by the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", but our role is to serve a healthy public conversation ... focus less on thinking about free speech, but thinking about how the times have changed.\""}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Musk had been critical of Twitter's moderation of misinformation prior to his acquisition of the company."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " After the transition, Musk eliminated the misinformation moderation team,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and stopped enforcing its policy on labeling tweets with misleading information about coronavirus."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " While Twitter had joined a voluntary program under the European Union's to fight disinformation in June 2022, Musk pulled the company out of the program in May 2023."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "In August 2020, development of Birdwatch was announced, initially described as a moderation tool. Twitter first launched the Birdwatch program in January 2021, intended as a way to debunk misinformation and propaganda, with a "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " of 1,000 contributors,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " weeks after the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The aim was to \"build Birdwatch in the open, and have it shaped by the Twitter community\". In November 2021, Twitter updated the Birdwatch moderation tool to limit the visibility of contributors' identities by creating aliases for their accounts, in an attempt to limit bias towards the author of notes."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "Twitter then expanded access to notes made by the Birdwatch contributors in March 2022, giving a randomized set of US users the ability to view notes attached to tweets and rate them,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " with a pilot of 10,000 contributors."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " On average, contributors were noting 43 times a day in 2022 prior to the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ". This then increased to 156 on the day of the invasion, estimated to be a very small portion of the misleading posts on the platform. By March 1, only 359 of 10,000 contributors had proposed notes in 2022, while a Twitter spokeswoman described plans to scale up the program, with the focus on \"ensuring that Birdwatch is something people find helpful and can help inform understanding\"."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "By September 2022, the program had expanded to 15,000 users."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In October 2022, the most commonly published notes were related to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " based on historical usage."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " In November 2022, at the request of "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", Birdwatch was rebranded to "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", taking an "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " approach to deal with misinformation,"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " and expanded to Europe and countries outside of the US."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": "\n"}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", alongside "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", were heard by the "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", the case asked if Twitter and other social media services are liable for "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " terrorism content under the "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " in "}

{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " program."}

Naming five current or former workers as plaintiffs, the suit accused the company of violating federal and state laws that govern notice of employment termination."}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": " The federal law in question is the "}
{"title": ["Twitter"], "image": [], "desc": ", and the state law in question is California's state WARN Act."}

The Commission said that in 2014 when Facebook acquired the messaging app, it \"falsely claimed it was technically impossible to automatically combine user information from Facebook and WhatsApp.\" However, in the summer of 2016, WhatsApp had begun sharing user information with its parent company, allowing information such as phone numbers to be used for targeted Facebook advertisements. {"title": ["WhatsApp"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/WhatsApp.svg/170px-WhatsApp.svg.png"], "desc": "WhatsApp uses a \""}
{"title": ["WhatsApp"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/WhatsApp.svg/170px-WhatsApp.svg.png"], "desc": "\" mechanism for exchanging messages between two users. When a user sends a message, it is stored on a WhatsApp server, which tries to forward it to the addressee, and repeatedly requests acknowledgement of receipt. When the message is acknowledged, the server deletes it; if undelivered after 30 days, it is also deleted."}
{"title": ["WhatsApp"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6b/WhatsApp.svg/170px-WhatsApp.svg.png"], "desc": "\n"}

{"title": ["MongoDB"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/5a/MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg/250px-MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg.png"], "desc": "MongoDB provides high availability with replica sets."}
{"title": ["MongoDB"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/5a/MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg/250px-MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg.png"], "desc": " A replica set consists of two or more copies of the data. Each replica-set member may act in the role of primary or secondary replica at any time. All writes and reads are done on the primary replica by default. Secondary replicas maintain a copy of the data of the primary using built-in replication. When a primary replica fails, the replica set automatically conducts an election process to determine which secondary should become the primary. Secondaries can optionally serve read operations, but that data is only eventually consistent by default.\n"}
{"title": ["MongoDB"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/5a/MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg/250px-MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg.png"], "desc": "If the replicated MongoDB deployment only has a single secondary member, a separate "}
{"title": ["MongoDB"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/5a/MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg/250px-MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg.png"], "desc": " called an arbiter must be added to the set. It has the single responsibility of resolving the election of the new primary."}

The data is split into ranges (based on the shard key) and distributed across multiple shards, which are masters with one or more replicas. Alternatively, the shard key can be hashed to map to a shard \u2013 enabling an even data distribution.\n"}

By contrast, the AGPL only requires the source code of the licensed software to be provided to users when the software is conveyed over a network."}

If MongoDB predicts that a page is unlikely to be in memory, operations will yield their lock while the pages load. The use of lock yielding expanded greatly in version 2.2."}

{"title": ["MongoDB"], "image": ["//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/5/5a/MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg/250px-MongoDB_Fores-Green.svg.png"], "desc": " Jepsen, which describes itself as a \"distributed systems safety research company,\" disputed both claims on Twitter, saying, \"In that report, MongoDB lost data and violated causal by default.\" In its May 2020 report on MongoDB version 4.2.6, Jepsen wrote that MongoDB had only mentioned tests that version 3.6.4 had passed, and that version had 4.2.6 introduced more problems."}
